text: Stefan Jürgen Krämer (born 23 March 1967) is a German professional football manager. ==Career== He was appointed as the head coach of Rot-Weiß Erfurt on 30 December 2015. On 2 October 2017, he was sacked. In March 2018 he replaced Michael Wiesinger as manager of KFC Uerdingen. He was sacked on 28 January 2019. He joined 1. FC Magdeburg for the 2019–20 season. He was sacked on 22 December 2019. He returned to Uerdingen on 10 March 2020. On 13 April 2021, he was sacked. In early June 2021, Krämer became the new head coach of Eupen. He was sacked on 16 February 2022 after a string of poor results. ==Career record== Team From To Record SV Roßbach/Verscheid 1 July 2002 30 June 2011 Arminia Bielefeld 21 September 2011 23 February 2014 Energie Cottbus 1 July 2014 19 September 2015 Rot-Weiß Erfurt 1 January 2016 2 October 2017 KFC Uerdingen 15 March 2018 28 January 2019 1\. title: Stefan Krämer
